tei:p.tei:hi: Fragmentary handwritten draft letter from Schenker to Grunsky, undated [December 1908?]

tei:transcription.tei:p: An Grunsky — über Bruckner This source, not only fragmentary, but also written in pencil and somewhat smudged, presents great problems of legibility and comprehension. It is a horizontally folded sheet of paper ruled vertically on what is here called the “verso” as for an accountancy ledger; indeed, the inverted writing at the “end” of the document appears to have been the first thing entered on the sheet, S subsequently using the sheet as scrap paper, turning it upside-down and over to begin on the true verso, then continuing on the true recto. The transcription given here is in places speculative.

Wurde nun[?] ein[e] solche Art, den Inhalt zu[corr] beschaffen, schon[corr] allein genügen, den Inhalt als blos pappenartig zusammens.[etzen?] denn als noch organisch zu empf.[inden?], so steigert sich sp[e]z[ifisch] bei Br.[uckner], die Calam.[ität] noch weiter auch dadurch, daß er modulat.[orisch] den Weg zu der jeweilig den nächsten ESch. [Einschnitt?] eröffnend[en] Tonica nicht fand. This statement mirrors remarks made in the section of S’s “Niedergang” dealing with Bruckner’s music. That work, composed in the period 1905–08, originally intended as an "Afterword" to his Harmonielehre, and for a time (1906–1909) destined in S’s mind as vol. III of his Neue musikalische Theorien und Phantasien, remained unpublished, and survives in typescript (OC 31/28–153) under the provisional title of “Über den Niedergang der Kompositionskunst: eine technisch-kritische Untersuchung”; an edition and English translation with introduction, by William Drabkin, is available in Music Analysis 24/1–2 (March–July 2005), pp. 3–232, the section on Bruckner being pp. 212–15 (German), and 114–17 (English). Ein Cadenz zu dieser Tonica hin, schien ihm ^u. mit Recht^ nicht passend, die <strike>Modul[ations]partie aber mit enger</strike> anderen, einzig mögliche[n] Wege eine[?] rechtschaffen schöne[?] Mod.[ulation] nach[?] eingewob.[ener] Tonica der nächsten Tonart u. mit schon eigenen Gedanke[n?]. Meint[?] er nicht – folglich setzt er einfach <strike>wie</strike> eine Generalpause hin[?]

So sind denn die fabelhaft[en][?] Gp. [Generalpausen] nicht Zeichen etwa einer neue[n] Form, nein, nothw.[endige] Folge einer <strike>xx</strike>Verstiegenheit[?] zur Tonica der nächst. Gut[?] zu von [lacuna] Die Generalp. sind das, was ...[?] + den[?] Analphabeten.
In der V. Symph. sehen Sie ihn sogar[?] nach Es dur rund..[?] Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony is discussed in detail in the “Niedergang.”
Sie werden einwenden, wenn[?] ...cht.[?] hie/hin[?] arbeite[?] d.. doch auch der Inhalt als zweimal[?] 8 oder 12 Takte. Wie[?] kam der der w. ...[?] Z...[?] zu stande?
Plötzlich ^erzeugt^ Schluß VII Symph. Presumably Bruckner’s Seventh Symphony.

tei:translation.tei:p: Were such a manner [of composing] alone sufficient to provide the content, piecing the content together as on a pasteboard [in a collage?] rather than perceiving it organically, then in the case of Bruckner specifically the calamity escalates still further in that he did not through modulation find the path to the tonic initiating the next section in each instance. A cadence leading to this tonic appeared to him ^and rightly so^ not fitting, the <strike>but the modulation section with narrow</strike> other solely possible paths [to a] frightfully beautiful modulation to an interwoven tonic of the subsequent tonality and even with its own ideas. If he does not really intend it[?]—consequently he simply inserts <strike>as</strike> a general pause.

The [marvelous?] general pauses are thus not perchance a sign of a new form: No, [they are] [a] necessary consequence of eccentricity[?] leading to the tonic of the next tonality. Good to from [lacuna] The general pauses are that which [illeg] the illiterate person.
In the Fifth Symphony, you see him even[?] after Eb major ... ???
You will object if [illeg] rightly [illeg] though also the content as twice 8 or 12 measures. How did the [illeg] come to be?
